alert.note: Alert for Ogle (Illinois) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Chicago (Northeastern Illinois and Northwestern Indiana)
info.headline: Severe Weather Statement issued April 05 at 5:45AM CDT until April 05 at 11:00AM CDT by NWS Chicago
info.description: ...A SEVERE THUNDERSTORM WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 615 AM CDT FOR OGLE AND LEE COUNTIES... At 545 AM CDT, severe thunderstorms were located along a line extending from near Byron to near Lost Nation to 8 miles southwest of Woodhaven Lakes, moving east at 35 mph. HAZARD...60 mph wind gusts. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Expect damage to roofs, siding, and trees. Locations impacted include... Dixon, Rochelle, Byron, Oregon, Mount Morris, Amboy, Davis Junction, Hillcrest, Stillman Valley, Franklin Grove, Ashton, Paw Paw, Lost Nation, Sublette, Woodhaven Lakes, Creston, Lindenwood, Monroe Center, Leaf River and Grand Detour. This includes... Castle Rock State Park, Lee County Fairgrounds, Lowden State Park, Ogle County Fairgrounds, and White Pines State Park. Including the following interstates... I-39 between mile markers 78 and 114. I-88 between mile markers 47 and 82. TORNADO...POSSIBLE HAIL THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX HAIL SIZE...<.75 IN WIND THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX WIND GUST...60 MPH
info.instruction: For your protection move to an interior room on the lowest floor of a building.
